name: Hot Pot
description: A simmering pot of soup stock where diners cook their own ingredients including meat, seafood, vegetables, and noodles.

name: Horse Meat
description: Traditional horse meat dishes, often served as kazy (horse meat sausage) or in various other preparations.

name: Hawawshi
description: A Egyptian street food consisting of spiced ground meat stuffed into pita bread and grilled to perfection.

name: Dolma
description: Stuffed grape leaves or vegetables filled with seasoned rice, minced meat, and aromatic herbs.

name: Pilaf
description: A fragrant rice dish cooked with tender meat, carrots, onions, and various spices, considered the national dish.

name: Chicken Briyani
description: Aromatic rice dish made with Indian spices, chicken, and caramelized onions, often served with raita.

name: Camel Bump
description: A traditional delicacy made from the fatty hump of a camel, often prepared through slow cooking methods.

name: Kibbeh
description: Deep-fried croquettes made of bulgur wheat, minced onions, and ground meat, typically served with tahini sauce.

name: Pelmenye
description: Small dumplings filled with minced meat, served with sour cream and often in a clear soup.

name: Lobiani
description: Traditional Georgian bread filled with seasoned mashed beans, often served during fasting periods.

name: Beshbarmak
description: A traditional dish of boiled horse meat or lamb served over flat noodles with onion sauce.
